intro: Schultesia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved schultesia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Schultesia angustifolia is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
